last_episode_to_air.name: A Brief Encounter
last_episode_to_air.overview: A fed-up Miranda makes a big life decision: she's going travelling.

name: Miranda
overview: Socially inept Miranda always gets into awkward situations; working in her joke shop with best friend Stevie, being hounded by her pushy mother, and especially when she's around her crush Gary.

seasons.name: Series 1
seasons.overview: Miranda finds it impossible to stand up to her eccentric mother Penny who makes embarrassing and desperate attempts to marry her off. Her rivalry with boarding school chum and PR Sloane Tilly gets her in to all sorts of trouble as she can’t help but lie to impress her; and worst of all her hapless pursuits of long-term crush Gary means she always ends up flat on her face-- literally in most cases. All her old friend Stevie does is stand back, laugh and unhelpfully point out where she is going wrong.

seasons.name: Series 2
seasons.overview: Following the conclusion of the first series, the BBC commissioned a second series for BBC Two in 2010. Of this, Hart said "I am not only relieved but totally overwhelmed by the response and thrilled that people have enjoyed the series. I am very grateful for all the support and to the BBC for giving me the chance to do another series next year." Filming started during the first weeks of summer, and the new series began broadcast in November 2010. The second series comprises six episodes and saw the return of Miranda's mother and friends, Stevie, Gary and Tilly

seasons.name: Series 3
seasons.overview: Miranda and Gary have agreed to be ‘just good friends’ and so the third series finds Miranda desperate for another man to keep her mother off her case. Making a success of the shop wouldn’t go astray either…

episodes.name: Date
episodes.overview: Miranda gets overexcited by the prospect of her first real date and decides it's time to try to be more girly, but her makeover doesn't go quite to plan.

episodes.name: Teacher
episodes.overview: Miranda takes French class and Tango lessons so Gary will see her in a sexual light. Things don't quite go to plan.

episodes.name: Job
episodes.overview: Miranda's mother is ashamed of her joke shop job, so Miranda decides to find a new career.

episodes.name: Holiday
episodes.overview: Being young, free and single has its advantages, like jetting off to Thailand on holiday for a few days. Miranda however, sets her holiday sights lower.

episodes.name: Excuse
episodes.overview: An old school insists on throwing Miranda a party to introduce her to a suitable man. Miranda is notoriously bad at coming up with excuses, but when she sees a photo of her intended date he's so bad that the only option left is to lie and come out to her mother.

episodes.name: Dog
episodes.overview: When a handsome guy leaves his wallet in the shop, Miranda and Stevie argue over who he'd prefer to take to dinner if he had to choose one of them. Meanwhile, Miranda is invited to a regatta and is determined to be able to cope at a tricky social occasion just once.

1.name: Series 1
1.overview: Miranda finds it impossible to stand up to her eccentric mother Penny who makes embarrassing and desperate attempts to marry her off. Her rivalry with boarding school chum and PR Sloane Tilly gets her in to all sorts of trouble as she can’t help but lie to impress her; and worst of all her hapless pursuits of long-term crush Gary means she always ends up flat on her face-- literally in most cases. All her old friend Stevie does is stand back, laugh and unhelpfully point out where she is going wrong.

episodes.name: The New Me
episodes.overview: In a hilarious attempt to get over Gary, Miranda tries to reinvent herself.

episodes.name: Before I Die
episodes.overview: Worried about what people may say about her life, Miranda decides to try and do some good.

episodes.name: Let's Do It
episodes.overview: Miranda doesn't know how to cope when several men turn their affections towards her.

episodes.name: A New Low
episodes.overview: Miranda competes with Stevie to keep up with a new, young, trendy girl in town.

episodes.name: Just Act Normal
episodes.overview: Miranda and Penny find it impossible to be normal in a session with a psychiatrist.

episodes.name: The Perfect Christmas
episodes.overview: It's Christmas and Miranda would like a relaxing and fun time without her parents.

2.name: Series 2
2.overview: Following the conclusion of the first series, the BBC commissioned a second series for BBC Two in 2010. Of this, Hart said "I am not only relieved but totally overwhelmed by the response and thrilled that people have enjoyed the series. I am very grateful for all the support and to the BBC for giving me the chance to do another series next year." Filming started during the first weeks of summer, and the new series began broadcast in November 2010. The second series comprises six episodes and saw the return of Miranda's mother and friends, Stevie, Gary and Tilly

episodes.name: It Was Panning
episodes.overview: Penny threatens to cancel Miranda's Christmas if she does not sort her life out.

episodes.name: What a Surprise
episodes.overview: Penny embarrasses Miranda by running for local councillor with Tilly as her wingman.

episodes.name: The Dinner Party
episodes.overview: Miranda decides to prove to herself and her friends that she can officially be an adult.

episodes.name: Je Regret Nothing
episodes.overview: Trapped in her flat and being shouted at, Miranda is forced to think about her regrets.

episodes.name: Three Little Words
episodes.overview: Will Stevie persuade Miranda to declare her true feelings towards Gary?

episodes.name: A Brief Encounter
episodes.overview: A fed-up Miranda makes a big life decision: she's going travelling.

3.name: Series 3
3.overview: Miranda and Gary have agreed to be ‘just good friends’ and so the third series finds Miranda desperate for another man to keep her mother off her case. Making a success of the shop wouldn’t go astray either…
